job_title: Phlebotomist in San Antonio, TX
pros: free parking, decent food in the cafeteria, clean environment.
cons: Hospital & Laboratory management had been falling apart since 2020, so our laboratory director was under review by her bosses multiple times for the extremely high turnover. I have worked in much larger hospitals and have never seen the level of turnover with phlebotomists as I saw here. Many times if not always we would be working at 20% of employees during overcrowding in the hospital with no warning. We wouldn't know our schedules for 1-2 weeks until 1 day prior. Most times we were over-scheduled the hours we had been hired initially for. Guilt tripped if we turned down being called in on top of already working OT. Very hostile/toxic environment. Had employees hired that became physical with other employees, had written complaints from employees, patients, and Doctors, would show up late or not at all, and management chose to keep them instead of employees who were loyal and had been there for at least 6+ months when they were only there for less than a month in most cases. They underpay employees and pulled past employees from retirement when they couldn't hire new ones to replace them.

review_title: Horrible Management, Not team Oriented, Too Much Gossiping, Too Much Drama
job_title: Collector in San Antonio, TX
pros: Pay Check, Desk, Computer, "tele-phone"time
cons: Business management does not care about you as a person, they treat you like a  replaceable part, they use you up and spit you out, they work you dry give you a pat on the back and give you more and more work. They let the ignorant, loud, lazy people slack off and take advantage of the hard workers. They do not help you succeeded, management would much rather stir up drama and watch you fail and laugh behind closed doors about it. Their training is poor and management wonders why productivity is so bad, they blame it on their employes instead of themselves, they breach security and confidentiality agreements by sharing passwords, managements and employes are ALWAYS gossiping!!!!! Workers like to call you out on petty errors, and CC every one and their momma in email (not professional), NOT team oriented at all. TOO much drama, keep out of this place! Don't go to HR either, management WILL retaliate and make your life worse.

review_title: Great company culture and employees have wonderful spirits
job_title: in San Antonio, TX
pros: You really feel like family the moment you start! From fun and informative/paid new hire training, to the welcoming in you really feel happy to be apart of the team. Everyone works as a team to get the job done, and it's refreshing to see that from day in to day out.
cons: Lacking when it comes to competitive salaries. They recruit to make sure they find the best of the best but then once you've gone through at least two interviews they negotiate to try to bring you in and pay you the bare minimum. I don't think that's a great way to bring in top quality and expect them to stay.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX

review_title: Happy with work; unhappy with management.

New employees receive "on the job" training by co-worker/s. Without the aid of a P&P manual or a training manual no one knows if the employee has been given a chance to succeed.

job_title: Staff RN in San Antonio, TX

cons: Medical surgical units don't have free charge. Kind of like one man for himself.  They want you to provide the best patient care but yet under staff you. They almost always take patients side. If census drops they send home aids/clerks then we end up getting more New admits and are screwed. The people try to work as a team yet it is hard when you have your own heavy assignment. No support from management they just threaten to write you up or do write you up yet never help out the floors. Not very much support for new nurses either.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in San Antonio, TX

cons: Chronically understaffed, they would call me and beg me to come in, just to be floated to another unit. They would not let me know in advance that I would be floated even when I asked not to be due to inexperience and lack of orientation from the other units.

review_title: mixed feelings, love the people i work with and the hospital, hate the way the dept is treated by hospital management

review_title: Poor management for maintenance @ Northeast Baptist Hospital.
job_title: HVAC Technician in San Antonio, TX
pros:
Some good people to work with.
Stable work environment
cons:
•Hires under false pretenses. (What you apply for isn’t what you get)
•Management has no management skills
•Management and directors don’t know jack about basic equipment that they take care of.
•Supervision and management do not listen to professional advise to keep equipment maintained.
•Management has trust issues.
•Management shady about paying contractors.
•Constant micromanagement and patronizing attitude toward employees often to the point of harassment. 
•Very understaffed
•No night shift to take care of late night calls or issues quickly.
• promises of yearly raises never kept.
• no morale on the job, makes for zero motivation to continue working here.
• too much favoritism, buddy buddies with supervision get away with so much laziness and bs.
• favoritism goes as far as bringing in prior employees at other hospitals to work here and not giving a chance for outside people to key positions.
• they even go as far to create a whole position of “working manager” for a prior employee buddy to cover inadequacies of director.
• no recognition of good work and deeds for maintenance.
• Hospital cares more about doctors and nurses who destroy the place than the actual people who keep the building running.
• management would rather buy tools for themselves rather than order for employees who actually do the work.
• Under paid staff. Supervision even goes as far to belittle you saying you are the one of the highest paid ones here in reality you make way less than at other jobs.

review_title: Training weak and negatively applied, but work is challenging and personally rewarding.

review_title: Administration only cares about the money!
job_title: Staff RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Pretty flexible schedule. 3- 12 hour shifts.
cons: Tenet is by far the worst hospital I have ever worked at. They do not care about their staff at all what-so-ever. Being a floor nurse, you are just a number. The communication is very poor, and rarely do you have the help needed to actually be a compassionate care giver. The amount of work they expect you to do with no support is unbelievable.

job_title: Staff Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Benefits are pretty good, salary is competitive
cons: Management is not supportive of nursing staffs concerns.  There were even threats of termination made if complaints continued!

review_title: Hostile and petty. Power driven management and HR.
job_title: Health Related Personnel in San Antonio, TX
pros: None that I can think of.
cons:
Things have changed since Tenet Healthcare took over. They are simply a cut throat company which cares nothing about their employees or patient care. Management in this hospital is a joke. They will keep telling you flattering words but in the end your head will end up on the stick. Double standard is strong and present in this hospital. Those who care have to kill themselves to get the jobs done while the rest would do the bare minimum or nothing at all. All they have to do is kissing up to their bosses. The culture in this hospital is to shut your mouth. People are rude and nosy and are a bunch of back stabbers and they will abuse you whenever they can. And if you stand up to those abusers, you will be told that you were reacting badly and HR will be reviewing you. Bottom line, you need to shut your mouth and let those abusers enjoy abusing you or they will turn around and play victims and HR will listen to them but not you. Unethical practices from employees will be swept under the rug, and this is across the whole system not just at downtown facility. Ironically, those follow the rules usually won't get the same tolerance level and instead will be pushed to work harder to cover for those don't do their parts. So being unethical actually is more rewarding.

 They treat their employees as if they own us outright. These HR people all act like they are royalty and noble. Not a surprised since these people are not originally from Baptist but got sent here by Tenet. Totally different mind set and attitude. Since Tenet took over, almost all our best employees had left, either for better paid jobs somewhere or simply because they hated how they were treated. We all easily got a new job somewhere else quickly, got paid better, treated better and some of us advanced up the ladder faster. And they no longer offer sick days. You will have to use your vacation time if bad luck strikes and you are too sick to work. 

 For off shift employees, they would be the ones who got the worst. Their work load is double, triple vs day shift. They would be told to come in on their days off and would be scolded if they have a reaction. And they have to stay late in the morning to attend those stupid forum meetings where employees are asked for their donations to united way. I'm all for helping the community but just because the bosses now decide that they will no longer want to get in at 6 to conduct 1 session for off shift employees, now the whole crew will suffer. Speaking about leadership. We want to go home after giving shift reports, not listening about charity. And no, the 6pm session doesn't help either because night shifters come in at 10pm. 

 Baptist has become a nightmare and Tenet is running it to the ground. Their mentality is they don't need to retain you at all cost because they have that school which produces a bunch of new healthcare workers each year for them. They care nothing about their employees, even cut down on lunch menus. Cost for lunch goes up, options go down. We got like 10 cents for pay raise last year. It's pathetic. To evaluate our performances, they used a list of duties which was generalized by including all the responsibilities from all units. So if you are a nurse and the non nursing departments' performance dropped, you will be punished for it as well. So you kill yourself for a whole year trying to earn a good pay raise and in the end you are punished for someone else's mistakes. And everybody knows the whole hospital is short staffed but we kept hearing about the low productivity. It's easy to sit in your office all day and speculate instead of getting out there and see for yourself. If there are 7-8 patients per nurse, then it's delusional to talk about low productivity.

review_title: My Coworkers were great but Bapist Health worked me extremly hard with no Thanks or compensation
